instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.R7121: What is R7121? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7122: What is R7122? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spins once
threads.message:
was bit water damage around smc <RESISTOR>R5180</RESISTOR> <RESISTOR>R5179</RESISTOR> replaced, it was working for few days, now came back

-ultrasonic done, looks good actually

-green light is ok on cgarger
-fan spins once then dies
-<RESISTOR>R7121</RESISTOR> <RESISTOR>R7122</RESISTOR> are ok 10ohm, that area is not water damaged
- i can do smc reset
-it powers on on for a sec, aftger that i can start it again with the power button, but after 1 sec it goes down, and takes 0.34A
-when it powers on i can see 1.8V 1.05 5V, all of them, then the go away, but 8.59V 3.3V 3.4V remain, they are ok

-i replaced the bios from a donor board to see if it stays on but does the same, so i put back the original bios

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spins once
threads.message:
Liquid spill near SMC, so better to reball it.
Try to start in SMC bypass mode.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spins once
threads.message: I agree try SMC bypass mode the SMC could have been damaged.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spins once
threads.message:
yeah, in SMC bypass mode it turns on and there is picture

i will try to leave it overnight in full alcohol, maybe it can remove some crap under the smc, if that wont work i will reball it it, and have some donor board to replace SMC if needed to

thx!

threads.message:
Check resistance between pìns 17/18 and 27/28 at <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>.
Also post voltage for pins 9 & 15.

powers on 0.5A, fan spins, than dies, 

its not smc,

threads.message: with new smc it powers on in smc bypass mode, same as the original smc

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spins once
threads.message: L5001 is corroded, that give 3.24V to SMC, there was no connection to <CAPACITOR>C5001</CAPACITOR>, i fixed it with a cable but still same, to measue if connects to under the smc i hav eto remove again the SMC.....

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spins once
threads.message: What voltage do you get on PPBUS with just the charger when it spins once then doesn't turn on?

threads.message: <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> 9 and 15 pin both zero V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spins once
threads.message: PPBUS with only charger is stable 8.58V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spins once
threads.message: <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> 27/28 pin resistance 174ohm

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spins once
threads.message: <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> 18/18 3.4ohm

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spins once
threads.message:
That's your problem then is 27/28. One of the the following is true:

1. <RESISTOR>R7121</RESISTOR>/2 is blown or both
2. <RESISTOR>R7120</RESISTOR> is blown (possible but much less likely)
3. The traces from the ISL to <RESISTOR>R7121</RESISTOR>/2 are bad OR from <RESISTOR>R7121</RESISTOR>/2 to <RESISTOR>R7120</RESISTOR> are bad.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spins once
threads.message:
22 hours ago
Check resistance between pìns 17/18 and 27/28 at [URL="https://store.rossmanngroup.com/isl6259ahrtz.html"]<CHIP>U7100</CHIP>[/URL].
Also post voltage for pins 9 & 15.

so..

resistance between pìns 17/18   3.4ohm

resistance between pìns 27/28   174ohm

voltage for pins 9 & 15., both 0V


g3h is stable 8.58V, i have 3.3V 3.4V, green light on the charger

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spins once
threads.message: Yes your problem is pins 27/28 should be more like 21 ohms not 174 ohms. Check aforementioned resistors and traces.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spins once
threads.message:
Solve the problem with <RESISTOR>R7121</RESISTOR>/22.

Also check sensors at page 42.

threads.message:
i replaced <RESISTOR>R7121</RESISTOR>, now its 10 ohm both resistors, but same issue

also i checked them before, even in the original post i mentioned them, they were both good, <RESISTOR>R7121</RESISTOR> burnt later during diagnosis

threads.message: on <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> pin 1 and 3 the 3.3V comes up too for 1 sec, so evey voltage is ok for 1 sec

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spins once
threads.message:
Then even VCORE comes up 1s too.
If board starts in SMC bypass, all power supplies are good.
You have problems with some sensor.
Check pages 41-43...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spins once
threads.message: If you measure on pins 27/28 of the ISL and I mean the actual pins on the chip, do you get 21 ohms now?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spins once
threads.message:
yes its 21 ohm now, but it was 21ohm before, that was the first thing i checked, than i reballed and replaced the SMC, than the resistor went out, i replaced it, sothat part is ok now.

what i found is L5001, the pin after it was corroded, so the 3.4V did not come trough, it looks like that is the main power for the SMC, but than how come i had green light on the charger? now i fixed that connection with a wire L5001 to C 5001, but its the same. IS the SMC getting the 3.4V trough another trace? maybe i will cut the trace on a donor board to measure this...

i will check the sensors...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spins once
threads.message:
SMC main power rail goes to VDD pins.
VDDA and AVREF should be used by some analog blocks and AD converters.
AD converters are related with your problem, dealing with the sensors above mentioned.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spins once
threads.message: <CAPACITOR>C5125</CAPACITOR> was corroded, i just removed it and now it works
